meanings.definition: To cause (something) to change direction by interposing something; turn aside from a straight course.
meanings.sent1: She deflected the ball with her hand to change its path.
meanings.sent2: The mirror deflected the sunlight into the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat deflected the laser pointer beam onto the wall.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking deflected the attention away from his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella deflected the raindrops, creating a mesmerizing pattern on the ground.
